input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request. To execute multiple item, give multiple <item> element in the <items> element.
Update Problem:
This wrapper updates a problem record. Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>update-problem</operation-name> <model> <keys> <id> <value>P-0007</value> <type>String</type> </id> </keys> <instance> <id> <value>P-0007</value> <type>String</type> </id>
<incident-category> <value>shared infrastructure</value> <type>String</type> </incident-category> <subcategory> <value>workgroup</value> <type>String</type> </subcategory> <product-type> <value>applications</value> <type>String</type> </product-type> <problem-type> <value>none</value> <type>String</type> </problem-type> <initial-impact> <value>2</value> <type>String</type> </initial-impact> <severity> <value>2</value> <type>String</type> </severity> <description> <type>Array</type> <description> <element> <value>description line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>description line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </description> </description> <assignment> <value>AUTO</value> <type>String</type> </assignment> <ticket-owner> <value>CA 1</value> <type>String</type> </ticket-owner>
<category> <value>ITIL</value> <type>String</type> </category> <status> <value>Status</value> <type>String</type> </status> <logical-name> <value>AA</value> <type>String</type> </logical-name> <brief-description> <value>brief description</value> <type>String</type> </brief-description> <root-cause> <type>Array</type> <root-cause> <element> <value>root cause line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>root cause line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </root-cause> </root-cause> <update> <type>Array</type> <update> <element> <value>update line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>update line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </update> </update> <open> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </open> <open-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </open-time> <opened-by> <value>opened by</value> <type>String</type> </opened-by> <update-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </update-time> <updated-by> <value>updated by</value> <type>String</type> </updated-by> <close-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </close-time> <closed-by> <value>closed by</value> <type>String</type> </closed-by> <reopen-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </reopen-time> <reopened-by> <value>reopened by</value> <type>String</type> </reopened-by> <priority-code> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </priority-code>
<sysmodtime> <value>2007.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </sysmodtime> <sysmodcount> <value>2</value> <type>Decimal</type> </sysmodcount> <sysmoduser> <value>sysmoduser</value> <type>String</type> </sysmoduser> <assignee-name> <value>assignee name</value> <type>String</type> </assignee-name> <company> <value>company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <dump> <value>dump</value> <type>String</type> </dump> <resolution> <type>Array</type> <resolution> <element> <value>resolution line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>resolution line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </resolution> </resolution> <workaround> <type>workaround</type> <workaround> <element> <value>workaround line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>workaround line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </workaround> </workaround> <current-phase> <value>Problem Identification and Classification</value> <type>String</type> </current-phase> <incident-count> <value>3</value> <type>Decimal</type> </incident-count> <future-impact> <value>3</value> <type>String</type> </future-impact> <impact> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </impact> <users-affected> <value>10</value> <type>Decimal</type> </users-affected> <problem-start-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </problem-start-time> <expected-resolution-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </expected-resolution-time> <location-type> <value>location type</value> <type>String</type> </location-type> <frequency> <value>frequencey</value> <type>String</type> </frequency> <proposed-solution> <value>proposed solution</value> <type>String</type> </proposed-solution> <review-notes> <value>review notes</value> <type>String</type> </review-notes> <cause-code> <value>cause code</value> <type>String</type> </cause-code>
<affected-ci> <type>Array</type> <affected-ci> <element> <type>Structure</type> <ci-device-name> <value>AA</value> <type>String</type> </ci-device-name> <ci-device-type> <value>ci device type</value> <type>String</type> </ci-device-type> <ci-assign-group> <value>ci assignm group</value> <type>String</type> </ci-assign-group> <ci-location> <value>ci location</value> <type>String</type> </ci-location> </element> </affected-ci> </affected-ci> <affected-companies> <type>Array</type> <affected-companies> <element> <value>affected companies line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>affected companies line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </affected-companies> </affected-companies> <affected-ci-count> <value>20</value> <type>Decimal</type> </affected-ci-count> <last-task-no> <value>11</value> <type>Decimal</type> </last-task-no> <agreement-id> <value>12</value> <type>Decimal</type> </agreement-id> <contract-id> <value>13</value> <type>Decimal</type> </contract-id> <sla-breach> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </sla-breach> <next-breach> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </next-breach> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description:
Operation-name[Required]: Valid value: <operation-name>update-problem</operation-name>
Id [Optional]: unique id for the application. Valid values: any unique string. Default value: Ignored.
Incident-category [Optional], subcategory [Optional], product-type [Optional], problem-type [Optional]: NOT updatable Default values: Ignored.
Initial-impact [Optional]: Valid values: 1, 2, 3, 4. 1 > Enterprise, 2 > Site/Dept, 3 > Multiple User, 4 > User. Default values: Ignored.
Severity[Optional]: Valid values: 1, 2, 3, 4. 1 > critical, 2 > high, 3 > average, 4 > low. Default values: Ignored.
Description [Optional]: Valid values: It’s an array type element with each of its element can take String as input. Default values: Ignored.
Assignment [Optional]: Valid values: one of list of assignment group. For example, AUTO, CLIENT SECURITY etc. Default values: Ignored.
ticket-owner [Optional]: Valid values: one of list of problem owners. For example CA 1, CA 2 etc. Default values: Ignored.
category [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
Note: however, we should change it only to ‘ITIL’ as it’s present in ‘rootcausecat’ table.
status [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is set by application itself. The possible status are- open, closed, updated, assigned, work-in-progress, cancelled etc. Default values: Ignored.
Logical-name [Optional]: Valid values: Logical name of any EXISTING configuration item Default values: Ignored.
brief-description [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
root-cause: Valid values: It's an array type element with each element can have any string value. Default values: Ignored.
update [Optional]: Valid values: It's an array type element with each element can have any string value. Default values: Ignored.
open [Optional]: (NOT writable) Valid values: this field is maintained by application itself. Possible values of it are true or false. It keeps information whether the interaction record is opened of not. Open -> true: interaction record is opened, open -> false: interaction record is not opened. Default values: Ignored.
open-time [Optional]: Valid values: any input in date time format. Default values: Ignored.
Opened-by [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
update-time [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The possible values are of “DateTime” format. Default values: Ignored.
updated-by [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The value can be any string. Default values: Ignored.
close-time [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. The possible values are of “DateTime” format. Default values: Ignored.
Closed-by [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. Possible values are string type. Default values: Ignored.
reopen-time [Optinal]: Valid values: any input in date time format. Default values: Ignored.
Reopened-by [Optional]: Valid values: any stirng. Default values: Ignored.
Priority-code [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This element is maintained by application itself. Its value is same as that of <initial- impact> element. Default values: Ignored.
sysmodtime [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This element is maintained by application itself. It's of “DateTime” format. Default values: Ignored.
Sysmodcount [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This element is maintained by application itself. It's of “String” type. Default values: Ignored.
sysmoduser [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This element is maintained by application itself. It's of string. Type. Default values: Ignored.
assignee-name [Optional]: Valid values: Any string. Default values: Ignored.
company [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
dump [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
resolution [Optional]: Valid values: it's an array type element with each of its elment of string type. Default values: Ignored.
work-around [Optional]: Valid values: it's an array type element with each of its elment of string type. Default values: Ignored.
current-phase [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
incident-count [Optional]: Valid values: Any decimal. Default values: Ignored.
future-impact [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
impact [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
users-affected [Optional]: Valid values: any decimal. Default values: Ignored.
problem-start-time [Optional]: Valid values: any input in “DateTime” format. Default values: Ignored.
expected-resolution-time [Optional]: Valid values: any input in “DateTime” format. Default values: Ignored.
frequency [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
proposed-solution [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
review-notes [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
cause-code [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
affected-ci [Optional]: This is an array type of elment, with each of its element describes some particular configuration item. Default values: Ignored.
Ci-device-name [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
ci-device-type [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
ci-assign-group [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
ci-location [Optional]: Valid values: any string. Default values: Ignored.
affected-companies [Optional]: Valid values: It's an array type of element with each of its element of string type. Default values: Ignored.
Affected-ci-count [Optional]: (NOT writable.) This field is maintained by application itself. It's of “Decimal” type. Default values: Ignored.
last-task-no [Optional]: Valid values: any decimal. Default values: Ignored.
agreement-id [Optional]: Valid values: any decimal. Default values: Ignored. contract-id [Optional]: Valid values: any decimal. Default values: Ignored.
sla-breach [Optional]: Valid values: true, false. Default values: Ignored.
next-breach [Optional]: Valid values: any input of “DateTime” format. Default values: Ignored.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <hp-service-center-request> <xsl:if test="string('${username}') != ''"> <username>${username}</username> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${password}') != ''"> <password>${password}</password> </xsl:if> <entity> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">problem</xsl:text> </entity> <entity-type> <xsl:copy-of select="(//entity-type)[1]/text()" /> </entity-type> <request> <operation-name> <xsl:copy-of select="(//operation-name)[1]/text()" /> </operation-name> <xsl:for-each select="/items/item"> <parameters> <xsl:element name="${request element}"> <xsl:copy-of select="./model" /> </xsl:element> </parameters> </xsl:for-each> </request> </hp-service-center-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
Update Problem:
This wrapper updates a problem record.
